name: Kepler-378
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-378 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-378 is a star with 0.57 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.67 times its radius. It is located 498.27 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-378 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-378 b

Kepler-378 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.09 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-378.

The mass of Kepler-378 b is 0.48 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-378 b is 0.75 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-378 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-378 c

Kepler-378 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 28.91 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-378.

The mass of Kepler-378 c is 0.40 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-378 c is 0.7 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-378 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-378, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
